variant.question: The take-off of a jet aeroplane may be performed with "reduced thrust" in order to:

options.text: reduce maintenance costs.
reduce the risk of engine failure during take-off.
save fuel.
reduce take-off noise.

variant.question: Which of the following statements regarding reverse thrust is true?

options.text: At low speeds re-ingestion of the jet efflux may occur, causing overheat.
Reverse thrust may not be used on a slippery runway.
Reverse thrust may be used for landing but not for an aborted take-off.
The braking effect of reverse thrust is greatest at low speeds.

variant.question: Which of the following statements regarding reverse thrust is true?

options.text: At low speeds re-ingestion of the jet efflux may occur, causing overheat
Reverse thrust may be used for landing but not for an aborted take-off
Reverse thrust may not be used on a slippery runway
The braking effect of reverse thrust is greatest at low speeds

variant.question: One of the benefits of using reduced thrust setting for take off is the...

options.text: decreased wear of the engine and maintenance costs.
improved climb gradient.
decreased risk of bird strike.
decreased engine wear.

variant.question: Why is an engine vibration monitoring system installed on jet engines?

options.text: It monitors for changes in an engine`s vibration level, to indicate a possible engine failure.
To dampen changes in an engine`s vibration level, in order to meter the fuel flow.
It monitors the vibration at the engine pylon, to indicate an impending engine separation.
To register engine vibrations during flight in turbulent conditions.

variant.question: In a turbine engine, what is the parameter N1, which is used to represent thrust?

options.text: N1 refers to the rotational speed of the low speed spool which consists of the fan, the low pressure compressor and the low pressure turbine.
N1 is the ratio of the turbine discharge and the compressor inlet pressure
the indication is usually calibrated in percent RPM.
N1 refers to the rotational speed of the high speed spool which consists of the high pressure compressor and the high pressure turbine.

variant.question: In a turbine engine, what is the parameter N1, which is used to represent thrust?

options.text: N1 refers to the rotational speed of the low speed spool which consists of the fan, the low pressure compressor and the low pressure turbine.
N1 refers to the rotational speed of the high speed spool which consists of the high pressure compressor and the high pressure turbine.
the indication is usually calibrated in percent RPM.
N1 is the ratio of the turbine discharge and the compressor inlet pressure.

variant.question: In a turbine engine, what is the parameter N1, which is used to represent thrust?

options.text: N1 refers to the rotational speed of the low speed spool which consists of the fan, the low pressure compressor and the low pressure turbine
N1 refers to the rotational speed of the high speed spool which consists of the high pressure compressor and the high pressure turbine.
N1 is the ratio of the turbine discharge and the compressor inlet pressure
the indication is usually calibrated in percent RPM.

variant.question: A FLAT RATED jet engine will give:

options.text: a constant thrust for temperatures below a cut-off value
a constant thrust for temperatures above a cut-off value
decreasing thrust as temperature decreases below a cut-off value
increasing thrust as temperature increases above a cut-off value

variant.question: A FLAT RATED jet engine will give:

options.text: a constant thrust for temperatures below a cut-off value.
a constant thrust for temperatures above a cut-off value.
increasing thrust as temperature increases above a cut-off value.
decreasing thrust as temperature decreases below a cut-off value.
